posts.subject: Updating 08chan's code to fix the issues with the outdated version
posts.body:
You will need: git, g++ and npm.

To start drag the sidebar and click "This is my site" (prevents modifications from being overwritten).

In "ZeroNet/data/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D":
[code]
git init
git checkout -b 08chan
git add css dbschema.json index.html js static content.json
git commit -m 'backup'
git checkout -b master
git remote add upstream https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan.git
git fetch upstream master
git reset upstream/master --hard
[/code]

In js/millchan/config.js change these two lines:
[code]
this.domain = "08chan"
this.accepted_domains = ["08chan"]
[/code]

Optional:
[code]
wget https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/a/a5/InfiniteChanâˆžchanLogo.svg -O static/logo.svg
[/code]

Finally:
[code]
npm install
npm run prod
[/code]

After that, on 08chan, drag and side bar, reload the database and clear the browser cache.

To go back:
[code]
git checkout 08chan
[/code]
And reload the database and and clear the browser cache.

You're welcome.

>>e91f7405-c180-4b85-8ceb-a06c48bbbd3d
>What fixes does this do?
Pic related.

>risk
That's the reason you create a backup before doing the modifications.
Also, literally everything here is backed up by multiple peers.
In the worst scenario that you fucked your 08chan folder the only thing you need to do is to delete the site and then sync again.

Everything seems to work fine.
Not sure exactly how the memory usage compares with the outdated version but things could probably be refactored to use less resources.

>>08503965-2347-4bd4-9b6d-e39cdf2f05ec
>write a better engine from scratch
Okay. You start.

>>4269a999-30ad-4dad-a19c-19e5de0b7852
Try this.
[code]
git checkout css/style.css
[/code]
Then reload the browser CSS cache.

There was a problem with post quoting in the master branch.
Fetching the recent commits should fix that.

>>d9324a8b-7ff1-42b4-8c13-9cb29c299bfe
You don't need to manually delete the schema.
It should've been database reload in the OP which will auto trigger a database rebuild.

>>6ab9c4db-26f4-408f-86ba-548c5aa01625
>A database is not the same as the database schema.
Who the fuck said it was?
I'm talking about the options in the sidebar.
In the `Database` section there are two options `Reload` and `Rebuild`.
The first one will check the schema and force a rebuild in case something has changed.

>>4fa8172d-4f23-49a3-9304-dcf43414c30f
>I'm pretty fucking sure there's some gross memory leak somewhere in the code.
You have access to the full source code.
Find where it is and open a pull request to fix it.

>>8a928cfd-28bf-413e-85c8-79e4211e9f83
Use the force anonymous option.

>>f078ef3d-fbdf-4e21-816e-5888a0b5ccd2
Because he doesn't know what he's doing.

>>b474ae06-810c-4177-92dd-d956184b7e7e
If you blacklisted a board it can be unblacklsited in the Options menu (top-left).
If you muted a board owner then you will need to go to ZeroHello, click the 3 dots and click "Manage blacklsited users and sites".
